title: How Long, O Lord
verses: "How long, O Lord, how long?"—It was in heav'n
Was heav-en not enough! Happy, se-cure,
Jesus! they would have more—Even in bliss,
That prayerful voice was heard, From souls forgiven.
Robed in e-ter-nal bliss Would they have more.
The souls ex-pec-tant wait More hap-pi-ness.
They wait, even in heaven, Impatiently,
To see the troubled world At peace with thee.
They would behold their King, Once crucified,
Martyred still, disowned, And still denied,—
And may not we, too, join In heaven's song?
Should we alone not ask, "How long, how long?"

metadata.musical_notation: Present with treble and bass clef
metadata.theological_significance: Expresses the longing of heavenly saints for Christ's kingdom to come
